item.title: Northern Ireland Abortion and Gay Rights
item.author: Andy Wang,
item.description: Abortion was decriminalised in England, Wales and Scotland in 1967 and was made available through the NHS for free. Same-sex marriage was legalised in England & Wales in 2013 and 2014 in Scotland. Unfortunately, neither of these rights fully extend to Northern Ireland. In July, the UK government …

item.title: Graduate Work Visa Scheme will Benefit Current Students Graduating in or after Summer 2021
item.author: Andy Wang,
item.description: Last month the government announced the Graduate visa scheme, through which non-EU/EEA students graduating from a UK university could be granted a 2-year work visa. This was seen as a reimplementation of the previous Post-Study Work visa, which was scrapped by the then-Home Secretary Theresa May …
